result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Allic Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Allic Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC's request to review sentence credit--FILE, no further action taken

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua Klaff.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  PSI WAIVED.  Court orders 3 years WSP and 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with 15CF1355 but consecutive to 09CF838; DOC collect $518 costs; any testing/treatment deemed necessary; not eligible for prison programs; 52 days sentence credit.  Felon warnings advised.
Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Remanded back to BR 1 for scheduling.
Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JURY TRIAL WAIVED freely and voluntarily; Rights Advised; State Consents;  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Continued as set for trial

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Charles Allic Hill not in court.  Atty Joshua Klaff not in court.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken; Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, penalties and rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Cheniqua White appeared with Intern Christa Johnson for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Continued Preliminary Hearing 08-28-2015 at 1:30pm c/c Meyer, JAR
